attributes.action: address an economic solution in Iraq
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Whether or not we question, how and why there is a UK military presence in Iraq and Afganistan, the fact remains that we must fulfil statutory obligations to the UN. A more appropriate question might be to ask how to withdraw - The petitioner is pleased to hear news through the organisation "Cipe" that a Kurdistan business agenda has been launched - a coalition of associations -this is more like it - an advocacy tool for private enterprise , determined to play a positive role ! Not military - the guns may backfire. The petitioner is urging the P.M. to consider the policy initiatives currently advertised online -"Policies For Improving Access to Financial Services in Latin America: What Works and What Doesn't? " held by the Latin American Shadow Financial Regulatory Committee (LASFRC)which may be relevant or useful that looks at using interest rates against other financial innovations ? It may be handy to apply Columbian parallels to Afghanistan given in the case histories offered by the Center for Global Development.
